definition: cool and collected (idiom); showing no sign of nerves/perfectly composed
Mt Tai 泰山[Tai4 Shan1] in Shandong/abbr. for Thailand
safe/peaceful/most/grand
correct/right/so/thus/like this/-ly
self/oneself/from/since/naturally/surely
to seem/like/as/if

sentences.english: The bourgeois talked peaceably to the working-classes of what was in preparation.
sentences.chinese: 資產階級泰然自若地和工人們談論着正在準備中的事。

sentences.english: It remains unclear if Apple Computer, poised to launch its line of Intel-powered Macintoshes next year.
sentences.chinese: 他剩餘不明白的如果蘋果電腦泰然自若下水。

sentences.english: This sangfroid could be tested by several threats.
sentences.chinese: 這種泰然自若的姿態要經受多種威脅的考驗。

sentences.english: They'll readily defend their beliefs in civics class .
sentences.chinese: 他們泰然自若地在公民學課上爲自己的信念辯護。

sentences.english: Photography, however, is poised on a fine borderline between documentary and art.
sentences.chinese: 然而，攝影在記錄與藝術的邊界中泰然自若。
於我上方高處，泰然自若。

sentences.english: The good-tempered man tends to be unperturbed.
sentences.chinese: 好脾氣的人會泰然自若。

sentences.english: And I began to live just in the same compos' d manner as before;
sentences.chinese: 所以，我又像以前那樣泰然自若地過平生活了。

definition: calm/composed/at ease
calm/unruffled
calm and composed (idiom)
to talk and laugh as though nothing had happened/to remain cheerful (despite a crisis)
see 泰然處之|泰然处之[tai4 ran2 chu3 zhi1]
to remain calm in the face of events (idiom)
to handle the situation calmly (idiom)/unruffled/to treat the situation lightly
as if nothing had happened (idiom); calmly/nonchalantly
calm/unperturbed/(Taiwanese, Tai-lo pr. [lāu-sîn-tsāi-tsāi])
calm/self-composed
calm and collected/unperturbed
to be calm and unruffled in the midst of chaos or at a busy time (idiom)
to go easy/unhurried/calm/Taiwan pr. [cong1 rong2]
neither haughty nor humble/neither overbearing nor servile/neither supercilious nor obsequious
neither servile nor overbearing (idiom)/neither obsequious nor supercilious
calm and unhurried (idiom); composed/to take matters calmly
